title: SWML
description:
SWML is a scripting language-as-data for SignalWire products.
## Document fetching
If an incoming call uses SWML as its call handler, SignalWire will send
a POST method to the specified webhook with a JSON body containing
customer-defined script variables and the current call object:
```json
{
  "call": {
    "project_id": "project uuid",
    "space_id": "space_uuid",
    "call_id": "uuid",
    "state": "created",
    "type": "sip",
    "from": "sip:+15551231234@example.com",
    "to": "sip:+15553214321@example.com",
    "headers": [
      { "name": "X-Header-1", "value": "X-Header-1-Value" },
      { "name": "X-Header-2", "value": "X-Header-2-Value" }
    ]
  },
  "vars": {
    "customer_script_var_1": "customer_script_var_1_value",
    "customer_script_var_2": "customer_script_var_2_value"
  },
  "params": {
    "param_1": "param_1_value",
    "param_2": "param_2_value"
  }
}
```
The server MUST reply with a valid SWML script, using either the  `application/json`, `application/yaml`, or `text/x-yaml` content-type.
## Versioning
At the top level of a script will be a `version` field that is a string containing a semantic version for the document schema. Suggested use is MAJOR version reflects breaking changes where a script may not operate correctly without changes such as existing methods having new required parameters or renaming and refactoring.  The MINOR version can be used as new methods are introduced or new optional fields for existing methods, and PATCH version can be used to reflect only the most minor bug fixes which still have some impact on the schema.
## Document Execution
The document contains a `sections` field that is a mapping of named sections for execution. The `main` section is always executed first. There must always be a `main` section in the document. The `transfer` method is used to jump to sections in the document or to a new URL.
Each section is an Array of strings or objects. Strings can be used for methods that do not require parameters like `answer`, `hangup`, or `denoise`. Use objects to execute methods with parameters. Each string or object in the section's array is executed in order until the section is completed. If there are no more methods to execute, the call ends.
## Expression Evaluation with JavaScript
All text wrapped in `%{}` is evaluated as JavaScript or as a plain variable substitution.
### Variables and call parameters
All variables and call parameters are delivered in the POST body to the URL in `transfer` and `execute`. Use the `set` and `unset` methods to set or delete variables.
Variables are only set or unset as a side effect of SWML methods executed by the script. All variables can be referenced inside `%{}` JavaScript expressions using the `vars.` JavaScript object.
Variables can not be permanently changed inside JavaScript expressions. Use the `set` method to do that.
All Call object parameters may be referenced inside JavaScript expressions. For example `%{call.from}` or `%{call.headers['X-Customer-ID']}`. Call object parameters are read only.

sections.title: Sections
sections.description: Functions available for scripting. The name `main` is used a  the default entrypoint. Functions defined in a `sections` share a common context (set of variables).

:l.description: line number in the source code

:c.description: column number in the source code

:i.description: index number in the source code

connect_sip_headers.title: Connect SIP headers
connect_sip_headers.description: SIP headers to add to INVITE. Has no effect on calls to phone numbers.

codecs.description: Comma-separated string of codecs to offer. Has no effect on calls to phone numbers.

webrtc_media.description: If true, WebRTC media is offered to the SIP endpoint. Has no effect on calls to phone numbers.

session_timeout.description: If >0, SIP Session-Expires header in INVITE is set to this value. Has no effect on calls to phone numbers.

call_state_url.title: call_state_url
call_state_url.description: webhook url (http(s)) to which send call state change notifications

call_state_events.title: call_state_events
call_state_events.description: an array of call state event names to be notified about. Allowed event names: `created`, `ringing`, `answered`, `ended`. Defaults to `["ended"]`

oneOf.description: SIP URI or phone number

sip_codec_list.title: Supported SIP codecs
sip_codec_list.description: A comma-separated list of SIP codecs

meta.title: metadata
meta.description: Metadata provided by the customer. Not used by SignalWire.

oneOf.description: A function that takes no parameter and which return value is ignored. This is a shortcut for `{ code: […code…] }`.
A regular function

^[a-zA-Z0-9_$]+$.description: Each named parameter must be a valid JSON datatypem specified by the application.

result.title: Result
result.description: Result returned by this function. The result must be a valid datatype specified by the application.

block.title: Block
block.description: A list of statements, meant to be executed in sequential order.

oneOf.description: type of block
type of block
section in document to jump to
relay context to notify (NOT IMPLEMENTED)
URL to fetch next document from. Sends HTTP POST
section in document to jump to

expression.title: Expression
expression.description: String with embedded `%{}` blocks containing JavaScript expressions.

anyOf.description: ring tone to play. For example: `ring:us` to play single ring or `ring:20.0:us` to play ring for 20 seconds.

speech_language.title: Speech language
speech_language.description: Used notably for Text To Speech (TTS) conversion.

dtmf_digits.title: DTMF digits
dtmf_digits.description: A string of "digits" (including the star `*` and octothorpe `#`) that may be generated as audio tones during a call.

sendable_dtmf_digits.title: Sendable DTMF digits
sendable_dtmf_digits.description: A string of "digits" (including the star `*` and octothorpe `#`) that may be generated as audio tones during a call. Use `w` and `W` for pauses.

text.title: Text
text.description: The instructions to send to the agent. Optional. Default is not set.

frequency_penalty.title: Frequency Penalty
frequency_penalty.description: Aversion to repeating lines. Float value between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values decrease the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim. Optional. Default is 0.

presence_penalty.title: Presence Penalty
presence_penalty.description: Aversion to staying on topic. Float value between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values increase the model's likelihood to talk about new topics. Optional. Default is 0.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: Randomness setting. Float value between 0.0 and 2.0. Closer to 0 will make the output less random. Optional. Default is 1.0.

top_p.title: Top P
top_p.description: Randomness setting. Alternative to temperature. Float value between 0.0 and 1.0. Closer to 0 will make the output less random. Optional. Default is 1.0.

confidence.title: Confidence
confidence.description: Threshold to fire a speech-detect event at the end of the utterance. Float value between 0.0 and 1.0. Decreasing this value will reduce the pause after the user speaks, but may introduce false positives. Optional. Default is 0.6.

result.title: result
result.description: Set up a switch on return_value by using an object or a cond statement by using an array.

native_functions.title: Prebuilt functions
native_functions.description: Prebuilt functions the AI agent is able to call.

functions.title: array of functions
functions.description: An array of JSON objects to define functions that can be executed during the interaction with the AI. Optional. Default is not set. The fields of this object are the six following.

includes.title: array of includes
includes.description: An array of objects to include remote function signatures. The object fields are url to specify where the remote functions are defined and functions which is an array of the function names as strings.

web_hook_url.description: Default settings for all SWAIG functions. If defaults is not set, settings may be set in each function object. Optional. Default is not set.

web_hook_auth_user.description: Default auth username for web_hook_url endpoint. Optional. Default is not set

web_hook_auth_password.description: Default auth password for web_hook_url endpoint. Optional. Default is not set.

active.description: Whether the function is active. optional. Default is true

function.description: A unique name for the function. for example "get_weather". Required

meta_data.description: A JSON object containing any metadata, as a key-value map. Optional Default is not set

meta_data_token.description: Scoping token for meta_data. If not supplied, metadata will be scoped to function's "web_hook_url". Optional. Default is set by SignalWire

data_map.title: An object containing properties to process or validate the input, perform actions based on the input, or connect to external APIs or services in a serverless fashion.

web_hook_url.description: Function-specific URL to send status callbacks and reports to. Takes precedence over a default setting. Optional. Default is not set.

wait_file.description: A file to play while the function is running. `wait_file_loops` can specify the amount of times that files should continously play. Optional. Default is not set.

wait_file_loops.description: The amount of times that wait_file should continously play/loop. Optional. Default is not set.

web_hook_auth_user.description: Function-specific auth username for web_hook_url endpoint. Takes precedence over a default setting. Optional. Default is not set.

web_hook_auth_pass.description: Function-specific auth password for web_hook_url endpoint. Takes precedence over a default setting. Optional. Default is not set.

purpose.description: A description of the context and purpose of the function, to explain to the agent when to use it. Required.

argument.description: A JSON object defining the input that should be passed to the function. The fields of this object are the following two parameters. Required.

type.description: A JSON object defining the input that should be passed to the function. The fields of this object are the following two parameters. Required.

properties.description: A JSON object describing the argument. The value is set by the user. For example, "location" for a location-based search or "company" if searching a database of companies. This object has sub-parameters description and type to help define the property.

expression.description: An array of objects that define patterns and corresponding actions.

output.description: Defines the response or action to be taken when the pattern matches.

response.description: A static response text or message.

action.description: A list of actions to be performed upon matching.

webhooks.description: An array of objects that define external API calls.

expressions.description: A list of expressions to be evaluated upon matching.

url.description: The endpoint for the external service or API.

headers.description: Any necessary headers for the API call.

method.description: The HTTP method (GET, POST, etc.) for the API call.

output.description: Defines the response or action to be taken when the pattern matches.

response.description: A static response text or message.

action.description: A list of actions to be performed upon matching.

string.description: The actual input or value from the user or system.

pattern.description: A regular expression pattern to validate or match the string.

output.description: Defines the response or action to be taken when the pattern matches.

response.description: A static response text or message.

action.description: A list of actions to be performed upon matching.

SWML.description: A SWML object to be executed.

say.description: A message to be spoken by the AI agent.

toggle_functions.description: Whether to toggle the functions on or off.

active.description: Whether to activate or deactivate the functions. Default is true

function.description: A list of functions to toggle

back_to_back_functions.description: Whether to execute functions back to back. Default is false

set_meta_data.description: A JSON object containing any metadata, as a key-value map.

playback_bg.description: A JSON object containing the audio file to play.

file.description: URL or filepath of the audio file to play.

wait.description: Whether to wait for the audio file to finish playing before continuing. Default is false

stop_playback_bg.description: Whether to stop the background audio file.

user_input.description: used to inject text into the users queue as if they input the data themselves.

context_switch.description: A JSON object containing the context to switch to. Default is not set.

system_prompt.description: The instructions to send to the agent. Default is not set.

consolidate.description: Whether to consolidate the context. Default is false

user_prompt.description: A string serving as simulated user input for the AI Agent. During a context_switch in the AI's prompt, the user_prompt offers the AI pre-established context or guidance. Default is not set

oneOf.title: Functions call with no arguments
oneOf.description: The name of a predefined function. The function is executed with no parameters, its return value is dropped, and only changes to the context are recorded.

oneOf.title: `request`
oneOf.description:
Runs an HTTP request
The following variables are set by this function:
- `request_result`: `success` | `failed`
- `request_response_code`: HTTP response code (e.g. `200`)
- `request_response_body`: unparsed response body
- `request_response_headers`: object containing the HTTP headers of the response
- `request_response`: parsed JSON response, if `save_variables` was set

headers.title: HTTP headers
headers.description:
Headers to send with the request.
The following headers are authorized:
- `Content-Type`
- `Authorization`
- `Accept`
- `Range`
- `X-` headers

oneOf.title: `switch`
oneOf.description:
Execute one block of commands based on a variable's value.
This is a simplified version of `cond`.

variable.title: variable
variable.description: a call parameter name, subroutine parameter access (starting with `params.`), or variable access

case.title: case
case.description: values mapped to blocks to execute

default.title: default
default.description: methods to execute if no cases match

oneOf.title: `cond`
oneOf.description: Branch based on conditions

oneOf.title: Conditional execution
oneOf.description:
If the condition expressed by the `when` expression is true,
the statements under the `then` section are executed, and
execution of the `cond` function is stopped.

oneOf.title: Default case
oneOf.description:
The statements under the `else` section are executed, and
execution of the `cond` function is stopped.
This should be used to indicate default treatment, and
should be the last branch in the `cond` function call.

oneOf.title: `prompt`
oneOf.description:
Play a prompt and wait for digit or speech input. Speech detection is not enabled unless at least one speech parameter is set.
The following variables are used, in addition to the parameters:
- `say_voice`: optional voice to use for `say:` URLs
- `say_language`: optional language to use for `say:` URLs
- `say_gender`: optional gender to use for `say:` URLs
The following variables are set by this function:
- `prompt_result`: `failed`, `no_input`, `match_speech`, `match_digits`, `no_match`
- `prompt_value`: the digits or utterance collected
- `prompt_digit_terminator`: digit terminator collected, if any
- `prompt_speech_confidence`: speech confidence measured, if any
URL to play

oneOf.title: Prompt function parameters
oneOf.description: Parameters for the `prompt` function

play.description: URL or list of URLs to play

volume.description: gain to apply to played URLs

oneOf.description: time in seconds to wait for next digit

initial_timeout.title: Initial timeout
initial_timeout.description: time in seconds to wait for start of input

oneOf.title: Speech timeout
oneOf.description: max time in seconds to wait for speech result

oneOf.title: Speech timeout as string
oneOf.description: max time in seconds to wait for speech result

speech_end_timeout.title: Speech end timeout
speech_end_timeout.description: time in seconds to wait for end of speech utterance

oneOf.title: `record`
oneOf.description:
Record call audio in foreground. This is recording for voicemails.
The following variables are set by this function:
- `record_call_url`: the URL of the newly created recording
- `record_call_result`: `success` | `failed`

direction.title: direction
direction.description: Direction of audio to record. speak = what party says. listen = what party hears.

input_sensitivity.title: input sensitivity
input_sensitivity.description: How sensitive the recording voice activity detector is to background noise. Large value is more sensitive.

initial_timeout.title: initial timeout
initial_timeout.description: How long to wait for speech to start

end_silence_timeout.title: end silence timeout
end_silence_timeout.description: How much silence in seconds to end recording.

oneOf.title: `record_call`
oneOf.description:
Record call in the background.
The following variables are set by this function:
- `record_url`: the URL of the newly created recording
- `record_result`: `success` | `failed`
- `record_control_id`: control ID of this recording

control_id.title: control id
control_id.description: Identifier for this recording to use with `stop_call_record`.

direction.title: direction
direction.description: Direction of audio to record. `speak` = what party says, `hear` = what party hears, `both` = what party hears and says.

input_sensitivity.title: input sensitivity
input_sensitivity.description: How sensitive the recording voice activity detector is to background noise. Large value is more sensitive.

initial_timeout.title: initial timeout
initial_timeout.description: How long to wait for speech to start

end_silence_timeout.title: end silence timeout
end_silence_timeout.description: How much silence in seconds to end recording.

oneOf.title: `receive_fax`
oneOf.description:
Receive a fax being delivered to this call
The following variables are set by this function:
- `receive_fax_document`: URL of received document
- `receive_fax_identity`: identity of this fax station
- `receive_fax_remote_identity`: identity of the sending fax station
- `receive_fax_pages`: number of pages received
- `receive_fax_result_code`: fax status code
- `receive_fax_result_text`: description of fax status code
- `receive_fax_result`: `success` | `failed`

- `send_fax_identity`: identity of this fax station

- `send_fax_pages`: number of pages sent

oneOf.title: `sip_refer`
oneOf.description:
Send SIP REFER to SIP call
The following variables are set by this function:
- `sip_refer_to`: The SIP URI the recipient is to INVITE
- `sip_refer_result`: Overall SIP REFER result
- `sip_refer_response_code`: recipient response to the REFER request
- `sip_refer_to_response_code`: INVITE response to the recipient

oneOf.title: `tap`
oneOf.description:
Start background call tap. Media is streamed over Websocket or RTP to customer controlled URI.
The following variables are set by this function:
- `tap_uri`: the destination URI of the newly started tap
- `tap_result`: `success` | `failed`
- `tap_control_id`: control ID of this tap
- `tap_rtp_src_addr`: if RTP, source address of the tap stream
- `tap_rtp_src_port`: if RTP, source port of the tap stream
- `tap_ptime`: packetization time of the tap stream
- `tap_codec`: codec in the tap stream
- `tap_rate`: sample rate in the tap stream

oneOf.title: Stream URL
oneOf.description: destination of tap media stream. rtp://IP:port, ws://example.com, or wss://example.com

control_id.title: control id
control_id.description: identifier for this tap to use with stop_tap

uri.title: uri
uri.description: destination of tap media stream. rtp://IP:port, ws://example.com, or wss://example.com

direction.title: direction
direction.description: Direction of audio to tap. speak = what party says. listen = what party hears. both = what party hears and says.

rtp_ptime.title: RTP ptime
rtp_ptime.description: If rtp:// URI, this optional parameter can set the packetization time of the media.

oneOf.title: `stop_tap`
oneOf.description:
Stop an active tap stream
The following variables are used, in addition to the parameters:
- `tap_control_id`: control ID of last tap stream started
The following variables are set by this function:
- `stop_tap_result`: `success` | `failed`

oneOf.title: control id
oneOf.description: ID of the tap to stop. If not set, the last tap started will be stopped.

control_id.title: control id
control_id.description: ID of the tap to stop. If not set, the last tap started will be stopped.

oneOf.title: digits
oneOf.description: The digits to send. Valid values are `0123456789*#ABCDWw`. `W` is a 1 second delay. `w` is a 500 ms delay.

oneOf.title: `ai`
oneOf.description:
Handle call through Artifical Intelligence (AI).
The following variables are set by this function:
- `ai_result`: `success` | `failed`

agent_meta_data.title: agent_meta_data
agent_meta_data.description: A powerful and flexible environmental variable which can accept arbitrary data. All contained information can be accessed and expanded within the prompt - for example, by using a template string.

prompt.title: prompt
prompt.description:
Context used to start the conversation. Also know as assistant prompt.
Example:
```
Your name is Franklin and you are taking orders for Franklin's Pizza.
The menu is as follows:
  small pizza: $13.99
  med pizza: $15.99
  large pizza: $19.99
  toppings: $1.50
  bottle of coke: $1.99
available toppings: pepperoni, sausage, mushrooms, green olives, green peppers.
Everything on the menu is available to order. You are never out of anything, you have an endless supply of everything.
Do not let the user order anything that is not on the menu above.
Collect the user's name and number and confirm the number of items before completing the order.
Start by introducing yourself and ask if the user wants to place an order.
```

post_prompt.title: POST prompt
post_prompt.description:
Context used to close the conversation. Use it to analyze the conversation and do one final thing after the call ends, like "summarize the conversation" or "extract my pizza order as json".
Example:
```
Please summarize my order as valid anonymous json object with three main keys: "contact_info", "pizzas", and "drinks".
Under the "contact_info" key, there are two values: "name" and "number", with the name and number of the customer.
Under the "pizzas" key, there is an array. Each element in the array represents a different pizza and contains three key-value pairs:
"size" (with a value of "large" , "medium" or "small"),
"price" (with a value of the price), and "toppings"
(with a value of an array containing the valid toppings "pepperoni", "sausage", "mushrooms", "green olives", "green peppers" ).
Under the "drinks" key, there is an array with one element for each drink.
This element contains two key-value pairs:
"type" (with a value of valid drink "coke") and "price" (with a value of the price for the drink).
Fill in any unknown data with null.
Do not use any words or code at all outside the json.
If you have not taken an order just send 'null'.
```

post_prompt_url.title: POST prompt URL
post_prompt_url.description:
Called on completion, receives a POST with JSON content:
- `appName`: the `name` provided as parameter, the static string `swml app`
- `callLog`: an array describing the conversation; each item is a
    `{role,content}` pair; this includes:
    - `system` role: provides context: date and time, the `promt.text` and `post_prompt.text`, remote party id name and number, call direction
    - `assistant` role: for responses from the AI chat
    - `user` role: caller's response, coming from the ASR
- `systemEnd`: an optional string containing the response, i.e. the value of `choices[0].message.content` in [AI Chat response](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/chat/response-format)
Supports `https://user:pass@example.com` format.

post_prompt_auth_user.title: POST prompt Authentication user
post_prompt_auth_user.description: Username for post_prompt_url. If provided in `postPrompURL`, the value in `post_prompt_url` takes precedence.

post_prompt_auth_password.title: POST prompt Authentication password
post_prompt_auth_password.description: Password for post_prompt_url. If provided in `post_promp_url`, the value in `post_prompt_url` takes precedence.

hints.title: hints
hints.description:
Hints for the Automated Speech Recognition system.
Example: [ "pizza", "pepperoni", "sausage", "mushroom", "green olive", "green pepper", "small", "medium", "large", "coke" ]

items.title: hint
items.description: Some expected utterance from the person talking to the AI

name.title: name
name.description: A textual description of the language, for example `English`.

voice.title: voice
voice.description: A voice model for this language, for example `en-US-Neural2-F` or `fr-FR-Neural2-E`.

pronounce.title: pronounce

ignore_case.title: pronounce ignore case
ignore_case.description: Ignore case when matching the `replace` string

conversation_id.description: Unique identifier for this conversation to be used to retain info from call to call

save_conversation.description: Send a summary of the conversation after the call ends

inactivity_timeout.description: Amount of time, in ms, to wait before exiting the app due to inactivity. Allowed values 10,000 - 3600000. optional. Default is 600000

ai_volume.description: Adjust the volume of the AI. Allowes volumes from -50-50. Default is 0

swaig_allow_swml.description: Allos SWAIG functions to return SWML to be executed by the call. Optional. Default is true.

conscience.description: Strictly enforce prompts. Optional. Default is true

oneOf.description:

Parameters obey variable substitution.
The following variables are set by this function:
- `return_value`: parameters after substitution.
